titleStmt.title: Description of Bryn Mawr College Library, MS 41: Orationes ad nicolaum V, etc.
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

availability.licence: These images and the content of Bryn Mawr College Library, MS 41: Orationes ad nicolaum V, etc. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Bryn Mawr College, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Bryn Mawr College Library MS 41: Orationes ad nicolaum V, etc.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: This fifteenth-century Italian manuscript contains six texts: Giannozzo Manetti, Oration to Nicholas V (fols. 1r-10v); Poggio Bracciolini, oratio ad summum pontificem Nicolaum V (fols. 11r-19r); Franciscus de Padua de Florentia, Letter to Nicholas V (fols. 19r-24r); Leonardo Bruni, Oratiuncula ad Martinum V (fols. 24r-26r); Leonardo Bruni, State Letter for the Commune of Florence to the Emperor (fols. 26v-27v); Leonardo Bruni, State letter for the Commune of Florence to the Council of Basel (fols. 27v-31v). The arms on fol. 1r suggest that the first owner was a member of the Picenardi family.

msItem.title: Giannozzo Manetti, Oration to Nicholas V
msItem.incipit: Si nobis coram sanctitate tua beatissime pater . . .
msItem.explicit: Caeterum quaedam alia restant quae cum sanctitati tuae placuerit, opportunioribus locis atque temporibus referemus. FINIT.

msItem.title: Poggii Florentini, oratio ad summum pontificem Nicolaum V
msItem.incipit: Scio consuetudinis esse beatissime pater omnium . . .

msItem.title: Franciscus de Padua de Florentia, Letter to Nicholas V
msItem.incipit: Si quid Beatissime pater de rerum tuarum magnitudine hac breui oratione dissero quod ad tuam uel laudem uel gloriam magis pertinere uideatur.

msItem.title: Leonardo Bruni, Oratiuncula ad Martinum V
msItem.incipit: Consueuerunt beatissime pater qui legationis officio fungentes sedem apostolicam . . .
msItem.explicit: Sunt alia quaedam a nobis seorsum tuae beatitudinis explicanda que cum tempus dabitur exponemus. Finita.

msItem.title: Leonardo Bruni, State Letter for the Commune of Florence to the Emperor
msItem.incipit: Serenissime ac gloriossisime princeps et domine post humilem recommendationem . . .
msItem.explicit: Mercatores autem egratiam et benignitatem regiam in suis negotiis reportent. Datum.

msItem.title: Leonardo Bruni, State letter for the Commune of Florence to the Council of Basel
msItem.incipit: Reuerendissimi in Christo patres et domini post humilem recommendationem.
msItem.explicit: Nec tam imprudenter facturis iste sapientiam sacri concilii de insipientia reprehendere a usu temerario praesumat.

supportDesc.extent: i+31+i; 215 x 140 mm bound to 225 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in ink, upper right recto

p.catchwords: Horizontal catchwords in center of lower margin

layoutDesc.layout: Single column written in twenty-one lines, ruled with single vertical bounding lines in ink; written area: 140 x 85 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1r includes a four-line gold initial on a blue ground entwined with white-vine stems on a pink, green, and dark blue ground with vine work; in the lower margin a border in the same style surrounds a shield, argent, with a unicorn rampant gules; this coat of arms appears to be a later addition; similarly styled four-line initials may be found on fols. 11r and 28r; three-line initials on fols. 19v and 24r; on fol. 26v a gold initial infilled with green and pink stands on a square blue ground to which a few thin gold lines have been added; headings in pale red
Inside front coverBookplate of Phyllis Walter Goodhart
1rFour-line illuminated initial S; a shield, argent, with a unicorn rampant gules in lower margin

binding.p: Modern calf, vertical gold stamp on spine: ORATIO FLORENTINORUM AD NICOLAUM V.; restored by J. McDonald Co. East Norwalk, Conn.

history.provenance: Written in Italy around 1450-60; the arms on fol. 1r suggest that the first owner was probably a member of the Picenardi family of Cremona; bought by Sir Thomas Phillipps from Payne; Phillipps number 4209 written on front pastedown in lead on fol. 1r in right lower margin in ink, on a printed label in the inner margin, and in the upper margin in lead; also on fol. 1r, in gutter, in ink "light cf"; on front pastedown, in lead: "£ 24--"; purchased from E. P. Goldschmidt by Howard L. Goodhart, and left by him to Phyllis Goodhart Gordan (bookplate) and John Dozier Gordan, Jr.; her bequest to Bryn Mawr College (bookplate) in 1995
